required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reliability of Ultrasound Examination of the Inferior Caval Vein
clinical_study.official_title: Reliability of Ultrasound Examination of the Inferior Caval Vein From Different Views in Critically Ill Patients on Artificial Lung Ventilation

lead_sponsor.agency: Emergency Medical Service of the Central Bohemian Region, Czech Republic

clinical_study.source: Emergency Medical Service of the Central Bohemian Region, Czech Republic

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare validity of examination and measurement of inferior caval vein from different views in critically ill patients on mechanical ventilation.

detailed_description.textblock:
A maximal and minimal diameter of inferior caval vein will be measured by transthoracic echocardiography in critically ill patients on mechanical ventilation hospitalised in the intensive care unit from four different views:
1. Subcostal view on the inferior caval vein in the long axis,
2. subcostal view on the inferior caval vein in the short axis,
3. right lateral view on the inferior caval vein in the long axis,
4. right lateral view on the inferior caval vein in the short axis.
Comparison between the results of measurements in the subcostal view in the long axis and other views will be performed.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between maximal and minimal diameter of the inferior caval vein from subcostal and right lateral view
primary_outcome.description: Inferior caval vein measurements are key parameters for assessment of preload and fluid responsiveness

arm_group.description: Critically ill patients hospitalised in the intensive care unit indicated to echocardiographic examination.

intervention.intervention_name: Conventional transthoracic echocardiographic examination at the intensive care unit.
intervention.description: Conventional transthoracic echocardiographic examination at the intensive care unit targeted to inferior caval vein examination from different views.

study_pop.textblock: Adult intensive care unit patients on mechanical ventilation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Inpatients
- Patients on mechanical ventilation indicated for transthoracic echocardiographic examination
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18 years
- Insufficient imaging quality
- Refusal of echocardiographic examination by patient
